techmeme.title: Oura Ring 4 review: comfortable, better data collection, and gorgeous, clean app, but requires a paid subscription to use basic features and colors cost more (Daniel Cooper/Engadget)
AWS aims to use "automated reasoning", which uses mathematical logic to encode knowledge in AI systems in a structured way, to prevent AI models' hallucinations (Belle Lin/Wall Street Journal)
The USPS resumes accepting China and Hong Kong mail hours after suspension due to Trump's EO, disrupting e-commerce, and is implementing "the new China tariffs" (Annie Palmer/CNBC)
Uber opens a waitlist to request a driverless Waymo vehicle in Austin, ahead of a planned launch later in 2025; Austin rides will be limited to 37 square miles (Natalie Lung/Bloomberg)
Uber reports Q4 revenue up 20% YoY to $12B, Gross Bookings up 18% to a record $44.2B, operating profit up 18% to $770M, and trips up 18% to 3.1B; UBER drops 5%+ (Rafe Uddin/Financial Times)
